Reviews.Title: “rooms should be renovated but fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: AlexMUC2012
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in fabulous location near blue mosque and hagia sophia. Free good wifi. Breakfast okay but greasy restaurant with great view over entire city. Rooms need to be refurbished with used matrasses and old shower. Worth it for a short city trip but dont expect perfect luxury as this is not an international chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go in winter”
Reviews.Author: Nancy M
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three days! We chose a corner room that was big! Bed was a little bit small and heating in the room was not enough! Room was hot after two days! At least was clean! Hotel staff was helpful and friendly, although we asked the receptionist for a nice Turkish place to eat meat and he sent us to a fish restaurant that was no meet at all! The breakfast buffet was acceptable but view from the top roof was amazing! You can have an extra ordinary view of all tourist attractions of sultanahmet area!!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Accomodations in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: wrmdispatcher
Reviews.Content: Made a booking with ADAC for the Arcadia in Istanbul. Its located minutes from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. The Grand Bazaar is a ten minute walk and the Spice Bazaar is perhaps 20 minutes away. The hotel itself is an older building with modestly furnished but comfortable rooms. The rooftop restaraunt serves an average buffet breakfast with a million dollar view of the Bosphorus and the Gulf of Marmara. Also sat there one afternoon sipping an EFES Beer and watching the sunset. If you want top flight, don't leave home luxury, then you would be better served elsewhere. If you want nice accomodations centrally located for a visit to the tourist locations of Istanbul its great. Plan on perhaps a 50TL taxi ride to the airport. A main trolley route stops just steps away from the door. A good pit stop for what was a pleasant 4 day trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “would not return to this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: CeiloWestMidlands
Reviews.Content: We chose the Arcadia on the recommendation of a respected tour guide that we know. His suggestion was based on location. For the first time in recent years I did not check the reviews on Tripadvisor before booking. I should have known better and will not repeat my mistake. The Arcadia hotel is indeed well placed for the attractions of the old part of the city of Istanbul. If you pay for a room on one of the higher floors you do get a good view - some rooms are corner â€œsuitesâ€� and you can see the Bosphorus as well as the Blue Mosque so without leaving your room you can enjoy the sights and sounds of the city and take in some splendid sunrises and sunsets. The downsides of this rather dowdy hotel remain much the same as reported in an earlier review. It looks much better from the outside. Our welcome tray contained one tea bag and one sachet of three in one coffee - milk powder and sugar already added. The room we had was looking a little worn with several areas of badly chipped veneer on the furniture tops. We had a new â€œprototypeâ€� bed that the hotel was apparently trying out which was fine. There is no central light, just two bedside lamps and a standard lamp. There are no other electrical plugs apart from these so to charge any batteries/laptops etc you have to do so without lights or overnight. As the room electricity cuts out when you remove the key it is not possible to leave anything on charge while you go out during the day. The bathroom was definitely in need of upgrading with a detachable spray shower head over the bath. No plugs in either the sink or the bath still. Fire escapes (to an exterior metal spiral staircase) on several levels remain either propped open to the outside air or obstructed with furniture / hoovers etc. The Reception staff are pleasant and helpful. I was surprised to see a Tripadvisor Certificate of Excellence on the desk however. Our main complaint was the breakfast. This is served on the roof which sounds lovely and indeed it should be. We ate there on the first morning only. The atmosphere is unpleasant. There is a lot of heavy duty plastic sheeting in use, presumably to cut down wind but it looks awful. More awful than that though was the coffee - instant and with milk already added - from a push button machine. All coffees seemed to come with a head of froth, even the black â€œAmericanoâ€� type and were very unpleasant. The â€œorange juiceâ€� was worse. It was orange in colour and any resemblance to the fruit juice ended there. That too came out of a machine. There were piles of unwashed dirty plates lying around. The open buffet did not look particularly fresh or appetising to us although to be fair other people seemed to be happy to eat it. The waitress was grumpy and the waiter was eating his own breakfast standing in the kitchen. We never go to Starbucks when at home in the UK but we went just down the street and had good coffee and juice there each morning for breakfast for the rest of our stay. We did report our dissatisfaction with breakfast to Reception on day one and asked if we could stay on a room only basis. We had paid in full on arrival which is hotel policy and our request was refused. We paid 1700 turkish lira for a four night stay so roughly Â£620 UK pounds - really not good value for money in my opinion so please do your pre-trip homework and find somewhere better for the price if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Receptionist was warned against cheating me of 60 TL by the Tourist Police.”
Reviews.Author: Fumcoat
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at a corner deluxe in early June and we satisfy the location, view, a quiet room and several nice staffs at roof top restaurant & front desk, off course. But a bell boy, Almid at evening to midnight & a receptionist Numan at morning cheated us of 60 TL (= 30 euro) for shared-ride airport shuttle bus from the hotel. According to the Tourist Police we asked later on, normal price to go to the Ataturk airport from old city by taxi is 32-37 TL (=16-19 euro). Why I cheated by them so easily is I didn't know the right price of Hotel Arcadia's pick-up service because airport pick-up service on arrival day was free (included room fee). The bell boy Almid came close to me & offered a shared-ride shuttle bus service which is managed by his friend when I went down to the front desk to ask airport shuttle bus. "I give you Discount Price, 50 TL for two person. My friend's company. Don't you mind it goes around other hotels to pick guests up?" He said. I said "No problem. And I don't like discount price & poor service. So you show me normal price of it." Then Almid offered me 60 TL and I paid it. He gave me a receipt for that. Why I didn't say "No, thank you" to his offer is that I didn't trust Hotel Arcadia's pick-up service. The airport pick-up car arranged by Hotel Arcadia didn't show in front of the arrival when we arrived the airport so that we walked up slope to the parking pushing heavy luggage cart. Even we couldn't get one euro deposit back for the cart when we reached parking building. The driver didn't care about the cart & deposit, only said "I don't know. Leave it!!" when I asked how to get back deposit at the parking. Then that midnight, I found that the price for shuttle bus from Sultanahmed to the Ataturk airport is from 10TL (=5 euro) on my guidebook. Next morning I asked Numan, a receptionist, the price for shuttle service for hotel guests. He immediately answered "30 euro". I decided not to trust these two men. I arranged way to go to airport & place to leave luggage at nearby hotel by myself, then told Numan to cancel the shuttle bus pick-up. He refused paying money back as I expected. So my husband & me finished claiming him and left the front desk for visiting the Toulist Police & sightseeing keeping the receipt for 60 TL in my hand. Then Numan asked me "Are you going to the travel agent?" watching the receipt I had. "No" I said. But when we'd just got out, we hear a bell boy (not Almid) screaming "Madame, madame, come back! He is calling you! Come back!!!". As I reluctantly go back to the front desk, Numan suddenly told me "I pay back from my own money. So give the receipt." "Why?" "I have to call the agent for cancel." We lost the receipt but a officer of the Tourist Police understood and believed me. As soon as the officer finished listening to my report, he told me "I warned them now." He called Hotel Arcadia and warned Numan. According to the officer, Numan said "I'm sorry, I'm sorry," again & again. While I was reporting to the officer, he said to me "Arcadia is a classed hotel. Shouldn't!" I agree with the officer. This kind of cheating shouldn't be happen at the classed hotel like Arcadia.

Reviews.Title: “"great location is what this hotel has going for it"”
Reviews.Author: lizizy
Reviews.Content: check your hairdryer works and persist in getting a replacement!

Reviews.Title: “If it is hot do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: fergrimes-7
Reviews.Content: We traveled with a tour group of 11 . The reservation for this hotel was made by the tour guide a year in advance because of its location close to so many important sites in old Istanbul and wonderful view from its rooftop restaurant. Our group was not privileged to receive its better rooms being assigned mostly to its lower floors. Despite unrelated persons sharing rooms, the hotel inconveniently refused to give more than one plastic key per room claiming that they did not have enough blanks and the keys kept needing to be reprogrammed as they often did not work. The breakfasts were good and the view unsurpassed. Unfortunately those were the best features of the hotel. The staff was unfriendly and the rooms needed maintenance badly. The air conditioning (in 90-100 degree weather) did not work, it just ,suffocatingly, blew hot air around and I was told that they cut it off in the night as an energy saving measure. Despite filling out forms and making requests at the desk nothing was done to fix it or to replace the broken hair dryer during our 5 night stay. Door locks and windows broke. The beds were lumpy and needed new mattresses. The rooms were very small with no place for luggage, and the towels were worn and like sandpaper. There was no soap for the shower and only liquid foam soap on the wall at the sink. The group elected to have dinner there one night and it was the most expensive and worst dinner of our stay in Istanbul. The restaurant staff were pleasant but not around at breakfast so that one could purchase Turkish coffee. The Nescafe coffee left much to be desired. Location and view are the only features worth staying here for.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: JayBeeDerbys_England
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights & wished we had booked for longer. This hotel is ideally situated for seeing the sights & catching the tram for further afield. The staff are friendly & arranged transport to & from the airport for us. A very welcome soft drink was waiting for us on arrival & the room was well stocked with drinks to purchase. Rooms are a little small as to be expected in this type of hotel. Breakfast is adequate but the view from the rooftop restaurant where breakfast is served has to be seen to be believed! Thoroughly enjoyed our stay & will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Place to finish or start your Istanbul visit”
Reviews.Author: David-Judith
Reviews.Content: The Arcadia is well located in the Sultanahmet, being just 200 metres from the Blue Mosque and the tram line and tram stop. There are numerous restaurants in the area as well. The staff were helpful, the room well appointed and spacious. Windows opened, but there was AC too. The roof top restaurant offers great views of the Blue Mosque and the Haghia Sophia as well as the entrance to the Bosphorus. Breakfasts are typical Turkish fare, but very well presented.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Cumfy and Central”
Reviews.Author: BRBhan
Reviews.Content: Hotel was selected for my spouse and myself by tour operator Curio Travel (a.k.a Ephesus Tours). It was prepaid in the hybrid tour (hybrid = tour guided plus self navigated) package, therefore I cannot reflect on bang-for-the-buck since I do not know the cost. We stayed there at the beginning of our tour, then again, towards the culmination of our visit - a total of six nights. As already reviewed elsewhere, the location is about a hundred steps off the main drag in Sultanhamet; very quiet and yet amenable to most Sultanhamet tourist sites touted by the Turkish travel bureau. Yes, one can easily walk to most of the sites. Upon arrival we were allocated a Corner room on the 5th floor. Corner rooms, are typically slightly larger and afford a better view. So, this was no exception. What irked me, though, was that upon return at the end of our 2-week stint in Turkey, we were unable to get a corner room, thus ending up in a slightly smaller abode. Since booking had been made in advance for both stays before and after the tour I feel the hotel owed an obligation to afford us the same amenity throughout. Just my thought. Must say the staff was extremely polite and professional. That includes restaurant staff at the glass-encased rooftop. So much so that the restaurant obliged us by refrigerating a can of caviar we had purchased (big bucks!) at the Spice Bazaar upon arrival. That 'extra' was highly appreciated. Befriended the restaurant manager. As he got familiar with our eating habbits he suggested a Special that was not on the menu. Turned out to be a large plate consisting of most of the appetizer menu offerings. Variety!! Total cost per plate was much less than the sum of each appetizer, when ordered individually. Rest of the staff was equally friendly. Unexpected? No. Turkish people, by nature are friendly and it is a visitor's duty to reciprocate. Summarizing hotel amenities: everything, viz service, pillows, mattresses, towels, general upkeep, etc. was OK. Hotel classes itself as a Boutique. I do not know the exact implication, having seen the best and the worst around the world. Could be a category relative to its surroundings. While I found nothing extraordinary I could classify this place as being in the Median by Western standards. An observation, especially useful to first-time visitors to Turkey: a) The upper-deck restaurant seems to be taller than surrounding buidings, with a very clear and commanding view of the lighted (at night) Blue Mosque; b) Fifteen steps right-wards from the Main entrance, in the opposite direction of the main, tourist-full street is a back alley that serves quite a different experience when headed to the Spice Bazaar or the boats. Should you return by this back street one can stop at either of the two tiny open air (clean) shacks for a refreshing yogurt drink. These two stores are located right-hand-side, at the beginning of the street when headed out of the hotel.. Conversely, they are on your left before the final right turn into the street where the hotel is located a fraction of a block away. Wi-fi is weak but hotel computers are available for the price of a smile. Would we stay there again? Yes, depending on the room rate :) BTW: 1. The $10 Garmin software for Turkey proved helpful in navigating our walks. 2. While smoking is prohibited in all Turkey hotels, the upper-deck restaurant has a dedicated, heated (if cold) section for smokers such as myself. In fact, this section offers a better overall view of Sultanhamet and the Bosphorus! Amen.

Reviews.Title: “Saty for the location, not for the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pisocuarto
Reviews.Content: Despite the fact that this is not a cheap hotel it is a "mean" hotel: the towels have passed their sell-by date. One tea bag (it might have been two) were provided on arrival and never replenished. Hotel policy we were told. The furniture in the rooms is becoming "tired". Refurbishment is due. No plugs in basins; supplied by reception if requested. The breakfasts were adequate, but that is all. The reception staff we would describe as unwelcoming and not particularly helpful. The public space is very limited and rather depressing. On the plus side, it probably has the best position in Sultanahmet with its restaurant having a view second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but greedy managment”
Reviews.Author: makychan
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and in a great location. The staff at the hotel were friendly and very welcoming. My Numan at reception was helpful and fast. The rooms were clean, beds were small and mattresses were cheap. The best employee there was Mr. Firat who saved us from getting ripped off by a taxi driver and took care of us. He gave us a run down of good restaurants and what to watch out for because turkey is full of scam artists. Room service was extremely expensive so was the restaurant. Breakfast was the same for 5 days in a row but ok none the less. Restaurant staff ahmed and Adam were very cool and made us feel welcome. Mangers on the other hand would not even let us talk to them. We wanted to check out early and we had paid a full rate but they would not refund us any money because they are greedy. you can tell their greed by the prices 180 euro for a bottle of regular scotch??? give me a break. Coffee was 8 euro!!! but in order for them to not refund us 80euro we will probably not stay there again although the staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: ToonTowner
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hotel Arcadia in September of 2010. We were very happy with our stay there. The hotel is very centrally located. We were within walking distance of the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar, and Hagia Sophia (Ayasofya) . Also a short walk away is Divan Yolu Caddesi, or the ancient road from Constantinople to Rome. This street is full of shops and restaurants. The hotel has a roof top restaurant that provides amazing views of Istabul, including the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus Bridge. The Bosphorus Bridge is a suspension bridge that has one side in Europe and the other side in Asia. The staff was very friendly and bent over backwards to help us in any way that they could. While the hotel does not have WI-FI or a business center, they let us use an office computer to confirm our flights. The rooms themselves are not unlike many hotel rooms you would find throughout Europe â€“ small by North American standards but very comfortable and clean. The hotel has 2 elevators. They are very small. A maximum of 4 people could possibly fit in one of them. This meant that there were long waits for them at times. We chose to take the stairs instead of waiting. We would not hesitate to stay at the hotel again or tell anyone we know about this little jewel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: HyacinthBucket049
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance of most of the attractions in Istanbul, including The Grand Bazzar. Rooms were comfortable and not to small. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Included breakfast well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “A bit shabby - but with a breathtaking view!”
Reviews.Author: Ros138
Reviews.Content: In truth, I had some minor issues with this hotel: - there was an open power point in my room, which would've been a real hazard for someone travelling with children; - carpets where threadbare in some points, and really frayed around the edges; - the lighting in my room was absolutely inadequate and made it impossible to read (or actually do anything other than watching tv) after dark; - shower had not enough pressure; - when the AC was turned on maximum ventilation (which was necessary, given the stifling climate in Istanbul), the fan made such a noise that it was impossible to sleep, so I ended up getting up many times in the night to adjust it; - the access to the emergency exit stairs was blocked by furniture (chairs and a table) on the 7th floor - a most serious safety issue, in my opinion; - staff at reception was by no means the most helpful I've ever encountered. But, having said all this, I'll also say that I was more than happy to overlook all of the above thanks to the absolutely priceless view of the Old City you can enjoy from the upper floors and the terrace restaurant. It's absolutely amazing and, in my opinion, reason enough to stay at the Arcadia despite its other faults. In the evenings, I would just sit at the window and gaze (partly because I couldn't read for lack of light, I'll admit). One word of warning, though. The hotel's close proximity to the Blue Mosque (which makes for the breathtaking view in the first place) does also mean, unfortunately, that you enjoy a possibly unequalled vantage point to hear the muezzin's call to prayer. Since the first one is just before 5 a.m., be prepared to be woken up before dawn. Or come well equipped with ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent staff, bedbugs, low A/C”
Reviews.Author: cantara_10
Reviews.Content: Summary - easy walking access to tourist spots, bedbugs found (be prepared), low A/C during the summer made for steamy sleeps, sufficient breakfast with spectacular panorama. Travelling as a family of 4 makes hotels difficult in Europe. They fit us into their bigger room (501) with 2 rollaway beds, but didn't have space to take out the chair and sofa making it cramped to move around. Not a big deal though since we didn't spend much time other than sleeping. Beds are passable except for the bedbugs (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bedbug). All of us were bit, and we're hoping not to have brought any home. A/C kind of worked during the day, but they turn off the central A/C at 2AM making it for a steamy night during the summer (daytime temps were 35+). Great location, easy walks to access major tourist spots Hippodrome, Sultanahmet, Topkapi Palace, Cisterns, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar, longer walks to Spice Bazaar, Galata bridge/Tower. Tram just a block away. Decent breakfast to start the day with spectacular panoramic views. Housekeeping was respectable (except for the bedbugs) as we had fresh towels and beds made every day.

Reviews.Title: “The view from the rooftop restaurant is reason enough to stay.”
Reviews.Author: adigression
Reviews.Content: Well situated in the Sultanahmet, and the view of the Blue Mosque and Sea of Marmara from the rooftop restaurant is really spectacular. In walking distance of the Grand Bazaar, the Turkish Baths (Cemberlitas Hamani), Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Arasta Bazaar, Underground Cisterns, restaurants and bars, and probably much more in very short walking distance. Rooms are small. Twin beds in what, I guess, is a double. AC doesn't seem to truly work much of the time (fan runs but doesn't cool); however, it was comfortable enough with a nice breeze from the window. Friendly, helpful staff. Complimentary, reliable wifi. Streets quiet at night except for the beautiful call to prayer. This was my first visit to Istanbul, so I don't know how the Arcadia compares to others in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic position and views”
Reviews.Author: NonnieSydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at a great rate organised on the internet 7 months earlier. HAd a large corner room with a beautiful view of the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus. The rooms are a little tired but comfortable, and the location makes up for the negatives - unappetiisng breakfast and not over helpful staff - and the views from the breakfast/dining room should not be missed. The location is wonderful - two minutes walk from the tram stop on the main road, three minutes to the Blue Mosque, five minutes to the Grand Bazaar. The free pick-up or drop-off to the airport is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “a hotel on my heart”
Reviews.Author: crisCraiova
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect hotel with excellent services starting with the transfer from the airport,conditions of accomodation, breakfast and especially the kindness of the entire personnel. The location of the hotel and restaurant is magnifique, just in the heart of the city and for all these reasons I will come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: psygirl
Reviews.Content: sorry for the delayed. my hubby and i stayed at this hotel during June/08 for our honeymoon. we joined a private tour which the tour agency picked this hotel for us. i have to say, if i have a choice, i would pick another hotel. pros: 1) good loc. - within the old istanbul, nearby historic sights, restaurant, bar and grocery 2) great view - especially on the roof top, you can see the blue mosque and other structure...absolutely amazing cons: 1) old structure 2) aged furniture and fixture 3) moderate service 4) moderate housekeeping 5) poor air ventilation - i have to turn off the A/C to prevent the smell of molds circulate around the room would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “amazing views of blue Mosque, small cozy hotel, superb location, good staff and service.”
Reviews.Author: wgafster09
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Arcadia hotel on a weekend trip on a layover in Istanbul. The rooms had breathtaking views of the blue mosque as did the breafkast room upstairs. The service was great and the location was superb. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: digvijayps
Reviews.Content: We were in Istanbul & had booked Ambassador Hotel for one day only. our intention was to check it out & extend the stay if suitable. Unfortunately no room was available for subsequent days & on consulting the Hotel Staff , zeroed on Arcadia which was not too far off. In fact, we found Arcadia, a four star Hotel to be better than the previous one. It is located close to the famous Blue mosque & other attractions . Good, airy, fairly big rooms with high quality bath room & good view. The staff was efficient & friendly. Breakfast was reasonable, probably a minus point for this otherwise a good hotel. Thje hotel is close to the market where many restaurants providing variety of food are available. Local train station, preferable mode of commuting & bus stops are with in 100 m from the hotel. Taxis can be easily hailed. The Hotel also organised a good Hamam for us. Considering the reasonable room rates & other features given above, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: ciana7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a short walk from the Blue Mosque, Agha Sofia and the Grand Bazaar. I had a corner room which was very spacious, clean and comfortable. The staff were pleasant, though not terribly helpful at times. If i can make one suggestion - if you stay here, don't miss the view from the upstairs restaurant at night. Absolutely breathtaking!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly,very convenient and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: schlimm
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just 3 nights in this lovely city. The Arcadia was perfectly placed for walking to most of the most interesting places. The views from the roof terrace at breakfast over the city roofscape and minarets of the Blue Mosque to the sea were unrivalled. At first sight our corner room [better than the other rooms] looked dull but in fact it was a very good size and very comfortable if a little old fashioned and short of drawer space. The tea and coffee making facilities and complimentary fruit bowl did not happen which was our only complaint. The staff are all very cheerful and helpful and we were very happy to have chosen this hotel. We would certainly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Please re-educate your staff”
Reviews.Author: coffeeyiandying
Reviews.Content: In" hardware", this is a nice hotel, but in" soft ware", it should work harder! Can you believe it? When we went upstairs to eat breakfast, those waiters play computer games( it seems like talking on MSN is more important than serving customers), when one of our group members( a girl) sat alone, a waiter( I don't know his name, it soumds like Mohammed or something like that) tried to chat-up with her! She felt uncomfortable, but she didn't tell us immediately, because she didn't know if it was normal in Turkey! "Sexual harassment!" She said. What a pity! A good hotel with a bad service. So, if Arcadia wants to raise up its evaluation, the boss should pay more attention to his staff!

Reviews.Title: “Come for the location and views!”
Reviews.Author: Palmsea
Reviews.Content: Hotel Arcadia definitely did not have the greatest rooms, but the location was great. We were on the 5th floor and had a great view of the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. The rooms are a little shabby and worn, but the location and views make up for it. The hotel staff was more then helpful, and it was a pleasant experience eating breakfast on the rooftop terrace. The free Wi-Fi in rooms and lobby was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning view, good location”
Reviews.Author: Jeannine88
Reviews.Content: My room was located on the sixth floor with an incredible view, especially in the evening when the Blue Mosque and the Hagya Sophia were lighted. The size of the room was ok, the cleaning also; the bathroom had some hydraulic problems. The breakfast buffet was sufficient, the quality of the coffee excellent, the view even better than from the room, as you could see even the Bosphorus. The negative point: restaurant personnel with a rather unacceptable amount of "attentions".

Reviews.Title: “good value choice, I would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: LeaAthens
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered a location that puts you in walking distance to sites, but is also a quiet area. The price we paid was about 70 euros a night. The breakfast itself is nothing special really, just some breads, jams, and cakes to eat, but the view from the rooftop breakfast room is great. . We were mistakedly placed in a room that hadnt been cleaned, and they happily moved us. The new room wasnt spotless but OK. The service was a bit laid back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Ballynac
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with a group of friends in February 2009 and was really pleased with it. The location is fantastic, the hotel was clean and tidy and nicely decorated. The staff were friendly and helpful and the level of English was sufficient at all times. The views from the rooms on the front of the hotel and from the rooftop breakfast room and the terrace are amazing - pretty much 360 degree view of the city, with the Blue Mosque and the Agha Sofia front and centre! Picture perfect! Location-wise, it's a five minute walk to the Blue Mosque, Agha Sofia, Basilica Cistern. It's 10-15 minutes walk to Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, Eminonu and Galati Bridge. The tram that runs across the Galati Bridge stops at the top of the street, a couple of minutes away. Yet the hotel itself is on a quiet street set back from the hustle and bustle. This location is perfect for your stay in Istanbul if you're looking to stay in Sultanahmet. The only negatives I would mention is that the room I stayed in, which was a single, was tiny even by European standards. It didn't bother me too much as I was only wanted a room to sleep but some people may have a problem with that. Also, while my room was cleaned each day, it was terribly thorough - for example when I had a drink, the glass and empty bottle were not cleared away, eventhough the rest of the room and bathroom was cleaned. A very minor thing, but noticeable nonetheless. Overall, this is a nice hotel in an excellent location and I found it to be really good value for money. It made our visit to Istanbul so easy and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: mydogwrigley
Reviews.Content: I was a group leader for 22 people that stayed at the Arcadia Hotel in January 2009. My group was made up mostly of very well traveled people that average 35 years of age. We were booked through our tour operator so I had no direct dealings with the hotel prior to our arrival. We were originally booked at the Armada Hotel but they closed down for some renovations and we were switched to the Arcadia Hotel. I was initially a little concerned about this hotel when I read some reviews on Tripadvisor.com. A few reviews stated that this hotel was not clean and the staff was unfriendly. But, I am very happy to say that my group's experience couldn't have been better! The location was perfect. You are in the heart of everything and just steps away from all of the major sights. The group was spread out on floors 4, 5,6 & 7. All of our rooms had a spectacular view of the Blue Mosque....so be sure to ask for a room facing the blue mosque. Their dining room/bar is on the top floor and has even better views of the Blue Mosque and surrounding area. It was great to have our breakfast looking out over the blue mosque and have a drink before heading out to dinner and seeing it again at night. The hotel was very clean and the staff was very helpful. As a group leader I had to deal with them several times during our three day stay. The rooms and bathroom sizes were a nice size...not huge, but plenty of room to move around comfortably. They were comfortably decorated and the showers were strong and as hot as you wanted. Breakfast was a nice Turkish buffet breakfast. It had a good assortment of breads, cereals and veggies. The breakfast wasn't spectacular, but my group liked what they served and was more than satisfied. The hotel does have a computer with free internet. My tripmates said it was a bit slow...But hey, it was free! I had my own laptop and just used their free wireless internet in my room which worked out well. The hotel is located on a quiet side street so we heard no noise at night. You can hear the call to prayer at 5:30am, but the hotel was insulated enough that it wasn't loud enough to wake any of us up. I was fortunate to stay in one of the corner rooms which are much larger than their regular rooms. As the group leader during the slow season, I wasn't charged extra for this room so I don't know if the hotel charges more for a corner room or not. The corner rooms are quite large and have a nice seating area. The couches in the seating area were a bit tired, but I didn't go to Istanbul to spend time on the couch! If you can get a corner room and it doesn't cost too much more then you will be very happy with choice to upgrade. I give this hotel a solid 4 star rating based on my group's experience. I usually don't give a 4 star hotel a 5 star rating since I usually reserve this for 5 star hotels. So, If you want a very good hotel in a great location then the Hotel Arcadia would be a great place to hang your hat.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: kukula
Reviews.Content: This is a great value for the location. We found our rooms to be clean. The service was great and the location is superb. Be sure to visit the terrace top hotel at night for the views. They served an extensive Turkish breakfast. This is probably not a 4 star hotel ,but service was wonderful and the place was clean. Also, the concierge was very helpful. Just DO NOT ask for restaurant recommendations. They referred us to this horrible fish restaurant on the gellata bridge, where we were sarrounded by other americans and the fish was terrbile. The bill came out to about ~ 200 YTL. The Lobster was horrible, the sauce has pieces of shell in it and was completely inedible. With that said, the hotel is a nice place to stay just stay.
